content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?> <metadata>     <idinfo>      <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>Minnesota DNR - MIS Bureau</origin>         <pubdate>2010-04-22 00:00:00.0</pubdate>         <title catid="urn:noah:c9e78e34-f548-3add-ab36-bfc7d4707ad3">State Lands by Administrator - Forestry</title>         <mgmg1cid></mgmg1cid>           <pubinfo>             <publish>Minnesota DNR - MIS Bureau</publish>           </pubinfo>         <onlink>ftp://mgssun6.umn.edu/dex/fullset/</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>      <descript>       <abstract>DNR land ownership and administrative interest mapped to the PLS forty level.  This layer merges the DNR Control Point Generated PLS layer with IBM mainframe-based land records.  Land records in the layer depict lands administered by the DNR Division Forestry.  The data are limited to a forty level resolution.  Therefore, holdings that are less than a forty in extent are represented as a full forty in the data (although specific fields exist within the attribute tables that allow the user to identify these).  Detailed discussion on the issues associated with the application of this data can be found at: http://intranet.dnr.state.mn.us/mis/gis/pdf/landrecords_read.pdf</abstract>       <purpose>To provide Minnesota DNR resource managers and land records specialists access to DNR land records information in GIS format.</purpose>       <supplinf>Statewide</supplinf>     </descript>      <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>1/21/1999</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>Land record information is current as of 1/21/1999 (at the time of this writing).  Updates will follow first monthly and then weekly.  PLS forty base information dates range from 1998 vintage modern surveys to survey notes from the late 1800s.</current>     </timeperd>      <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>Monthly</update>     </status>          <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-97.5</westbc>         <eastbc>-89</eastbc>         <northbc>49.5</northbc>         <southbc>43</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>      <keywords>       <theme>         <themekey>land ownership, public land survey, PLS, land stewardship, natural resources, planningCadastre</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekey>Minnesota</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>      <accconst>unrestricted</accconst>     <useconst>Internal DNR use is unrestricted.  External use is constrained by the standard, general DNR GIS Data License Agreement</useconst>          <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntperp>           <cntper>Hal Watson</cntper>           <cntorg>DNR-MIS</cntorg>         </cntperp>         <cntpos>GIS Database Coordinator</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype>           <address>500 Lafayette Road, Box 11</address>           <city>St. Paul</city>           <state>MN</state>           <postal>55155-4011</postal>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>(651) 259-5508</cntvoice>         <cntfax>(651) 297-4946</cntfax>         <cntemail>hal.watson@state.mn.us</cntemail>       </cntinfo>     </ptcontac>      <browse>       <browsen>http://jmaps.dnr.state.mn.us/gis/dp_datasample.jsp?mpid=24000005&ptid=2&fcid=1&lname=State Lands by Administrator - Forestry</browsen>       <browsed></browsed>     </browse>      <native>Arc/Info 7.x</native>          <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <title></title>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>    </idinfo>     <dataqual>      <attracc>       <attraccr></attraccr>     </attracc>      <logic>Data are topologically consistent using ARC/INFO 7.2.1</logic>     <complete>Data are exhaustive within those geographic areas covered, although statewide coverage is not yet available.  Only those forties on which DNR has a land interest are included.</complete>          <posacc>       <horizpa>         <horizpar>Source layer pls40ne3:  Variable. At its least accurate, the data is based upon points derived from manual digitizing of PLS section corners from 1:24,000 scale paper media (GISMO and SECTIC-24K points).  At its most accurate, the data is based upon points collected using GPS units operating at a sub-meter level of accuracy.  Refer to the ACCURACY and METHOD fields in the related PLS Control Point layer (cornrpt3), for specific information. </horizpar>       </horizpa>       <vertacc>         <vertaccr>Source layer pls40ne3:  Not Applicable </vertaccr>       </vertacc>     </posacc>           <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srcscale>Source layer pls40ne3:  24000 </srcscale>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc></procdesc>       </procstep>     </lineage>    </dataqual>     <spdoinfo>      <indspref>Not Applicable</indspref>     <direct>vector</direct>     <mgmg3obj>polygon</mgmg3obj>     <mgmg3til>state</mgmg3til>    </spdoinfo>     <spref>      <horizsys>       <geograph>         <latres></latres>         <longres></longres>       </geograph>       <planar>         <mapproj>           <mapprojn>Transverse Mercator</mapprojn>           <mgmg4par>Not Applicable</mgmg4par>           <otherprj>Not Applicable</otherprj>         </mapproj>         <gridsys>           <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn>           <utm>             <utmzone>15</utmzone>           </utm>           <spcs>             <spcszone></spcszone>           </spcs>           <mgmg4coz></mgmg4coz>           <mgmg4adj>Not Applicable</mgmg4adj>         </gridsys>         <planci>           <coordrep>             <absres></absres>             <ordres></ordres>           </coordrep>           <distbrep>             <distres>Source layer pls40ne3:  Variable. At its least accurate, the data is based upon points derived from manual digitizing of PLS section corners from 1:24,000 scale paper media (GISMO and SECTIC-24K points).  At its most accurate, the data is based upon points collected using GPS units operating at a sub-meter level of accuracy.  Refer to the ACCURACY and METHOD fields in the related PLS Control Point layer (cornrpt3), for specific information. </distres>           </distbrep>           <plandu>meters</plandu>         </planci>       </planar>       <geodetic>         <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn>         <ellips>GRS1980</ellips>       </geodetic>     </horizsys>     <vertdef>       <altsys>         <altdatum>Not If the township number ends with ".5", it is the half township - 58.5, range 17.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>RANG</attrlabl><attrdef>PLS range number</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>SECT</attrlabl><attrdef>PLS section number</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>GLOT</attrlabl><attrdef>PLS government lot number</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>PARC</attrlabl><attrdef>Parcel number - currently not used.  The original intent of this field was to use this code in relation to the forty or government lot to identify unique parcels.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>FORT_DESC</attrlabl><attrdef>PLS forty (quarter-quarter) description using text.  The descriptions should be read in the following way: NWNE is the Northwest 1/4 of the Northeast 1/4.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>GSEQKY</attrlabl><attrdef>The Land Records sequence number, a primary key in the Land Records.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>DNRDOCNO</attrlabl><attrdef>DNR document number</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>CTYDOCNO</attrlabl><attrdef>County Document number.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>LCTPIN</attrlabl><attrdef>County PIN number</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>LACRES</attrlabl><attrdef>The number of acres that have a State-owned interest within the PLS forty or government covered by this record.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>LPCT40</attrlabl><attrdef>The percent of the surface area of the PLS forty or government lot that is state owned.  LPCT40 = LACRES/(GLO acres for the forty or government lot) * 100.  If the number is less than 100, this record does not include the entire forty or government lot.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>LSFOWN</attrlabl><attrdef>State surface ownership.</attrdef><attrdomv><edom><edomv>Y</edomv><edomvd>Yes</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>N</edomv><edomvd>No</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>U</edomv><edomvd>Uncertain - generally means that there is a transaction in process</edomvd></edom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>LSRPCT</attrlabl><attrdef>Surface undivided interest given as a minerals, not researched</edomvd></edom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>LMINPCT</attrlabl><attrdef>Mineral undivided interest given as a Parks and Recreation</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>44</edomv><edomvd>Division of Waters</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>50</edomv><edomvd>Metro Greenways</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>62</edomv><edomvd>Trails Minerals</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>OHV</edomv><edomvd>Off-Highway Vehicle</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>SFT</edomv><edomvd>State Forest</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>SNA</edomv><edomvd>Scientific and Natural Area</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>SPK</edomv><edomvd>State Park</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>SRA</edomv><edomvd>State Recreation Area</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>SWS</edomv><edomvd>State Wayside</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>TRA</edomv><edomvd>State Trail</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>WAS</edomv><edomvd>Water Access Site</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>WAT</edomv><edomvd>Waters Dam Site</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>WBK</edomv><edomvd>Water Bank</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>WBP</edomv><edomvd>Wetland Bank Project</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>WMA</edomv><edomvd>Wildlife Management Area</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>WSR</edomv><edomvd>Wild and Scenic River</edomvd></edom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>LMGPRJ</attrlabl><attrdef>DNR administrator program/project as an 8-character code.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>CHGDATE</attrlabl><attrdef>Land Record change date, given as MM/DD/YYYY.  Indicates when the record was added or last changed.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>DOWNLOAD</attrlabl><attrdef>Download date - the date when the record was downloaded from the Land Records and matched to PLS40</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>RDIR</attrlabl><attrdef>PLS Range direction as a number, 0, 1, or 2, rather than West, East, West - half township or half range</attrdef><attrdomv><edom><edomv>0</edomv><edomvd>East</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>1</edomv><edomvd>West</edomvd></edom><edom><edomv>2</edomv><edomvd>West, but represents a half township (T58.5N R17W in St. Louis county) or half range (T160N R42.5W and T159N R42.5W in Roseau county)</edomvd></edom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>GLTMCH</attrlabl><attrdef>The geocoding field used to match the Land Records to the PLS40 base layer.  The format of this field is as follows:  CCTTTDRRSSFFGG, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, RR is RANG, SS is SECT, FF is FORT or "00" (see following note), and GG is GLOT.  Note:  if the GLOT is greater than 0, such as government lot 1, the FF part of GLOTMATCH is set to 00. </attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>GEOSECT</attrlabl><attrdef>A PLS description to the section level.  It is a combination of the COUN, TOWN, RDIR, RANG, and SECT fields.  The format of this field is as follows:  CCTTTDRRSS, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, and SS is SECT.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>GEORANG</attrlabl><attrdef>A PLS description to the township and range level.  It is a combination of the COUN, TOWN, RDIR, and RANG fields.  The format of this field is as follows:  CCTTTDRR, where CC is COUN, TTT is TOWN, D is RDIR, and RR is RANG.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>COUNTXT</attrlabl><attrdef>The county name.</attrdef></attr><attr><attrlabl>FORT</attrlabl><attrdef>PLS forty number (that is, the quarter-quarter section), rather than a text description such as NWNE.  (FORT is based on the MLMIS40 codes that have been used in the state for many years.)  In cases where there is a government lot, the FORT code provides a locational reference to where the government lot can be found in the
